item.title: Reimagining Journalism in the Age of Social Media
item.description: A presentation about how journalism might be reimagined in an age when more people are embracing the precepts of social media. Given by JD Lasica on Aug. 25, 2011, at El Mercurio in Santiago, Chile, during a 2-day symposium attended by news executives and managers from major publications in South America.
item.content:encoded: A presentation about how journalism might be reimagined in an age when more people are embracing the precepts of social media. Given by JD Lasica on Aug. 25, 2011, at El Mercurio in Santiago, Chile, during a 2-day symposium attended by news executives and managers from major publications in South America.

item.title: Sequencing the Startup DNA - @mrogati's talk at StartupFest 2011
item.description: What makes entrepreneurs different, and where do they come from? Are they born or taught? Are they unusually mobile in their careers? Does geography play a role? Do mentors and relationships matter? Numerous studies explore these questions by surveying hundreds of entrepreneurs. At LinkedIn, we take a different approach, on a different scale. By sifting through more than 120 million public profiles, we can analyze tens of thousands startup founder# profiles - and find common threads linking their careers. Video: http://startupfest.techstart.tv/?video=228
item.content:encoded: What makes entrepreneurs different, and where do they come from? Are they born or taught? Are they unusually mobile in their careers? Does geography play a role? Do mentors and relationships matter? Numerous studies explore these questions by surveying hundreds of entrepreneurs. At LinkedIn, we take a different approach, on a different scale. By sifting through more than 120 million public profiles, we can analyze tens of thousands startup founder# profiles - and find common threads linking their careers. Video: http://startupfest.techstart.tv/?video=228

Numerous studies explore these questions by surveying hundreds of entrepreneurs. At LinkedIn, we take a different approach, on a different scale. By sifting through more than 120 million public profiles, we can analyze tens of thousands startup founder# profiles - and find common threads linking their careers.
Video: http://startupfest.techstart.tv/?video=228

item.title: Strategy is Nothing Without Speed
item.description: Some 70% of strategic plans are never executed. To stay competitive, new timeframes and approaches are needed to bridge the gap between strategy and execution. Part 2 in the Living with Wolves series by Rolf E. Kleiner.

item.title: Hurricane Irene Viewed on Thursday by Space Station Cameras
item.description: Cameras mounted on the International Space Station captured new views of Hurricane Irene as it churned across the Bahamas at 3:47 p.m. EDT on August 25, 2011. Irene, which is a massive and powerful category 3 hurricane, is moving north-northwest toward a likely brush with the outer banks of North Carolina Saturday before tracking up the mid-Atlantic states and a possible path over the metropolitan New York area and New England late this weekend. http://www.nasa.gov/multimedia/videogallery/index.html?media_id=108385021
item.content:encoded: Cameras mounted on the International Space Station captured new views of Hurricane Irene as it churned across the Bahamas at 3:47 p.m. EDT on August 25, 2011. Irene, which is a massive and powerful category 3 hurricane, is moving north-northwest toward a likely brush with the outer banks of North Carolina Saturday before tracking up the mid-Atlantic states and a possible path over the metropolitan New York area and New England late this weekend. http://www.nasa.gov/multimedia/videogallery/index.html?media_id=108385021
item.author: nasa@slideshare.net(nasa)

Cameras mounted on the International Space Station captured new views of Hurricane Irene as it churned across the Bahamas at 3:47 p.m. EDT on August 25, 2011. Irene, which is a massive and powerful category 3 hurricane, is moving north-northwest toward a likely brush with the outer banks of North Carolina Saturday before tracking up the mid-Atlantic states and a possible path over the metropolitan New York area and New England late this weekend.
http://www.nasa.gov/multimedia/videogallery/index.html?media_id=108385021
